title: Handle 'Web control' role requests with clear in-app guidance (no new role)

requirements.text: Update user-facing copy to explicitly clarify that a requested "Web control" / "World Wide Web Controller" role is not supported by this application, and guide the user toward the supported roles (App Controller, Security, ICP Controller) that can actually be granted.

quotes: Add Web control to my access

acceptanceCriteria: Roles & Access panel text explicitly mentions that "Web control" / "World Wide Web Controller" is not a supported role name in this app.
The UI clearly states (in English) that only these roles exist: App Controller, Security, ICP Controller.

The UI provides a clear next step: instruct the user to share their Principal ID with the App Controller to request either the Security role (for security/audit features) or the ICP Controller role (for ICP operations).

requirements.text: Update the Access Denied screen copy for authenticated-but-unauthorized users to include an explicit note that "Web control" access cannot be granted because it is not a supported role in this app, and point users to requesting Security or ICP Controller access instead.

quotes: Add Web control to my access

acceptanceCriteria: When an authenticated user sees Access Denied, the page includes a sentence stating that "Web control" is not a supported role in this application.
The page continues to show the userâ€™s Principal ID and one-click copy, and the guidance text recommends requesting Security or ICP Controller from the App Controller.

constraints: Do not add any new backend roles beyond the existing roles (App Controller, Security, ICP Controller).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Do not edit any frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed in frontend immutablePaths.
nonGoals: Implementing a new "Web control" role (or any equivalent new role) in the backend canister.
Changing role authorization rules for existing roles (App Controller, Security, ICP Controller) beyond copy/UX guidance.
